channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Cawston Park: Vulnerable patient deaths prompt hospitals warning
item.description: A series of failings was found in the care offered to three adults with learning disabilities.

item.title: Bristol petrol station siege: Man arrested and another injured
item.description: Staff are seen fleeing to a safe room and loud bangs are heard in the stand-off in Bristol.

item.title: Derbyshire boy's racist group included terrorism plot member
item.description: The cases of a boy and a neo-Nazi are now linked after reporting restrictions are lifted.

item.title: Cressida Dick: Prime minister urged to replace Met Police commissioner
item.description: Paul Gambaccini and the brother of murdered investigator Daniel Morgan are among those demanding change.

item.title: Kidnapper dubbed 'every woman's nightmare' jailed
item.description: Omar Alam is described by a judge who jailed him for life as "every woman's living nightmare".

item.title: London transport staff warned of anti-vaccination posters with razor blades
item.description: The Rail, Maritime and Transport (RMT) union says its members are at risk.

item.title: Blackpool hotel needs planning permission for asylum seekers
item.description: Plans to house 324 asylum seekers at the Metropole Hotel in Blackpool have been criticised.

item.title: Hitachi train cracks due to fatigue and corrosion, report says
item.description: A government report reveals why Hitachi trains, which had to be withdrawn, developed cracks.

item.title: Refuelling driver hit by own car at petrol station dies
item.description: Police say the driver was struck by the vehicle as it rolled away from the pump in Broughton Astley.

item.title: Football memorabilia collection sells for almost £400,000
item.description: The collection of medals and shirts, amassed over six decades, was expected to fetch £170,000.

item.title: Richard Dunn: Boxer's family sent rare fight footage after appeal
item.description: Richard Dunn's relatives are able to replay his European title victory after rare footage is found.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand: 'I have to explain the monkey emoji to my kids'
item.description: Former England footballer Rio Ferdinand tells MPs about his experience of online hate and racism.

item.title: The rapper giving away school uniforms to kids on free school meals
item.description: Inspired by Marcus Rashford, Jords has donated over 100 blazers to children on free school meals.

item.title: Leicestershire sisters on track for Olympic glory
item.description: Indienne and Shaikira have both recently been crowned national champions.

item.title: 9/11: 'All we could see was smoke in the distance'
item.description: A couple reflect on how close they came to being caught up in the devastation of the 9/11 attacks.

item.title: Rochdale mosques enter Britain in Bloom in eco-friendly drive
item.description: Several Rochdale mosques are entering Britain in Bloom as part of a drive to be more eco-friendly.

item.title: Kidderminster factory fire: Residents return but schools stay shut
item.description: Some residents return home following evacuations due to gas canisters at the metal works.

item.title: Southern Health inquiry: Trust needs 'continuing reform'
item.description: Southern Health was investigated after failings were found in its care of five patients who died.

item.title: Dylan Rich: England team pay tribute ahead of Poland game
item.description: England's players display a shirt in memory of Dylan Rich, who died after a game in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Tottenham Hotspur Stadium wins RIBA architecture prize
item.description: The arena is a "tour de force in stadium design", the Royal Institute of British Architects says.

item.title: Global Teacher Prize: Two teachers in England up for $1m award
item.description: Teachers from Liverpool and Sevenoaks are in the last 50 in the hunt for the world's best teacher.

item.title: Emma Raducanu shock at reaching US Open semi-finals in New York
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu expresses her surprise at her run to the US Open semi-finals, having had flights back to the UK booked a fortnight ago.

item.title: Poland 1-1 England: Painful final minutes for England but they edge closer to Qatar 2022
item.description: England concede late on as their World Cup qualifier with Poland finishes 1-1, but edge closer to Qatar 2022 with the group in their hands.

item.title: T20 World Cup 2021: England name Tymal Mills in preliminary squad
item.description: Sussex fast bowler Tymal Mills is named in England's preliminary T20 World Cup squad and returns to the international set-up for the first time since February 2016.

item.title: 'I remember the stadium being built' - Exeter fan Yeandle begins 10th season at club
item.description: From fan to captain - Exeter hooker Jack Yeandle reflects on his time at the Chiefs as he begins his 10th season at Sandy Park.
